experience: You and Henrietta both know Kimberlie Cerrone, Lynda Bishop, and 34 others

The mission of the Convergence is to establish, sustain and advance a comprehensive and diverse healthcare workforce meeting the needs in the Inland Empire and East San Gabriel Valley, these communities are comprised of nearly 4.5 million persons in Riverside, San Bernardino and portions of Los Angeles Counties located in southern California. Responsibilities include the Collaboration with the eleven (11) members of the Executive Board (representing health services, education, providers, associations and payers) and other members to further the mission and goals of the Convergence. Other responsibilities include the development and implementation of short and long-range goals. Conduct research, write proposals, evaluate programs and initiatives, to achieve desired outcomes. Support the Executive Board in making key decisions pertaining to organizational structure, governance, and overall strategic plans. Seek funding opportunities by pursing grants or award offerings, membership expansion or other opportunities to ensure financial sustainability. Represent the Convergence and its members at various meetings, professional networking, public relations and fundraising events. Ensure that the organizational strategic plan and subsequent strategic initiatives are informed by current and projected health care delivery, workforce needs and regional market trends.
Project Director, Quality Improvement, Transforming Clinical Practice Initiative (TCPI)

Work with the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) in transforming Southern California Adventist Health Systems medical practices by implementing the Transforming Clinical Practice initiative (TCPI). The goal of the program is to transform clinical practice by soliciting physician participation, conducting baseline practice assessments, discovering practitioners’ desire for change, crafting customized plans, implementing desired changes, supporting adjustments as necessary and evaluating progress.

Healthcare Backgrounds supports the background screening needs of the healthcare industry. Our efforts support individuals and organizations by reducing risk, obtaining honest, competent and safe workforce, meeting regulatory requirements and providing peace of mind to those seeking medical services.

BANNER HEALTH SECURE HIRE is part of Banner Health’s system wide Risk Management network and is the provider of comprehensive background screens for 195 Banner Health hiring centers. Efforts by Banner Health Secure Hire keep patients, staff and visitors safe. Comprehensive Background screening also aids in the prevention of unnecessary risks and litigation; maintains compliance and supports our human resource specialists avoid poor quality hires. Other researchers have purported that comprehensive background screening also reduces turnover, absenteeism and mitigates the likelihood of negligent hires.

Responsible for the development and distribution of risk education programs; writing educational literature, brochures and manuals; updating policy and procedure incorporating protocols currently used in other states. Also supplied research on a variety of topics such as closed circuit camera systems, Legionella and background screening.

I have had the pleasure of working with Henrietta at Banner Health while she was Director of Secure Hire.  Henrietta's responsibility was oversight of the background process including drug screens and criminal checks.  Banner Health used to outsource this area but brought in Henrietta to build this department from scratch.  Henrietta hired and developed the department into a full-fledged background screening organization.  Henrietta is people focused an excellent communicator and a delight to work with.  Henrietta has determination built into her persona and I would highly recommend Henrietta.  Henrietta has now moved on to become CEO of her own background organization.  We will be moving to a new background vendor and she will be included in our RFP.

It is my pleasure to recommend Paul Dias in any capacity of Human Resources or Recruitement. I worked with Paul several years while we both were employed by Banner Health. Paul was responsible for onboarding of new staff and his responsibilities started with the extended offers and tracking and assisting each applicant as they were brought on as new hires. He was tenacious in completing necessary paperwork, which included background screening requests. Paul is driven, dedicated and an innovative problem solver. He is kind, articulate and extremenly professional in every task. I recommend Paul without any hesitation.
